text: Is there a version of `DataFrames.combine` that will get me past `a single value or vector result is required`?

DataFrames.combine
that will get me past

text: most likely, yes. Can you give an MWE?

elements.text: most likely, yes. Can you give an MWE?

text: do you just want `src => fun => AsTable`?

elements.text: do you just want
src => fun => AsTable

text: My return values are named tuples.  `AsTable` is cool, didn't know about that!

elements.text: My return values are named tuples.
AsTable
is cool, didn't know about that!

text: I kinda just want a vector of named tuples.  Is there a way to do that?

elements.text: I kinda just want a vector of named tuples.  Is there a way to do that?

text: You want the whole column to be a vector of named tuples?

elements.text: You want the whole column to be a vector of named tuples?

text: Yes, I'm converting the result to JSON and I'd rather have an array of objects than object of arrays

elements.text: Yes, I'm converting the result to JSON and I'd rather have an array of objects than object of arrays

text: If you wrap the returned named tuple in `Ref` that should work

elements.text: If you wrap the returned named tuple in
Ref
that should work

text: Perfect, much appreciated.  Thanks for the help!

elements.text: Perfect, much appreciated.  Thanks for the help!

text: fwiw I'm not sure if this is the kind of scenario we should be throwing an error for. Maybe file an issue?

elements.text: fwiw I'm not sure if this is the kind of scenario we should be throwing an error for. Maybe file an issue?

text: I guess since it's disallowed now we can add it in later, 1.X

elements.text: I guess since it's disallowed now we can add it in later, 1.X

text:
It is intentional for now as it was not clear if we should:
1. produce a vector of named tuples, or
2. produce a set of vectors as with `AsTable`
so we error as we can decide later which behavior we prefer and using `Ref` or `AsTable` allows to get both results.
